summary: All six previously-blocking gaps are addressed with concrete, testable acceptance criteria, and the revised plan is internally consistent enough for Sprint 1 to produce a runnable 5-blocking-gates pipeline and Sprint 2 to validate repair-loop convergence.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Missing freshness-check and registry-consistency implementations required by quality-gates.sh / Sprint 1 DoD
previous_issues_status.notes: Both checks are now explicitly specified as inline blocking gates inside quality-gates.sh with clear rules (HEAD SHA + generated_at window; yq joins across taxonomy/features/limitations). This satisfies the Sprint 1 DoD requirement without needing separate scripts.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: No executable entrypoint to run the 7-stage pipeline end-to-end (SKILL.md might not be sufficient)
previous_issues_status.notes: The plan now asserts (and tests) the Loa runtime contract: SKILL.md is the execution entrypoint. The added acceptance test that `/ground-truth --type capability-brief` invokes the skill and reaches GENERATE is a sufficient proof-of-executability for Sprint 1.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Citation extraction vs NUL-delimited/path-with-spaces ambiguity (no deterministic encoding rule)
previous_issues_status.notes: A deterministic rule is defined: citation paths are repo-relative and must match `^[a-zA-Z0-9_./-]+$` (no spaces). This makes extraction unambiguous and aligns with PATH_SAFETY + git-index matching.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: No deterministic golden fixtures + harness to objectively verify scripts and support convergence tests
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.17 adds fixtures + run-tests.sh with jq assertions, including at least one fixture that exercises all 5 blocking gates and one per failure mode. This is sufficient to make Sprint 1 verifiers testable and Sprint 2 convergence tests repeatable.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Provenance tag syntax and external reference patterns were underspecified, making check-provenance.sh non-deterministic
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.16 introduces provenance-spec.md defining the exact tag syntax, class set, citation patterns, epistemic markers, and evidence anchor syntax, and it is explicitly referenced by both SKILL.md and check-provenance.sh.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Repair interface undefined (prompt template, allowed edit surface, patching strategy, guardrails)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 2 task 2.1 and Sprint 1 task 1.15 now define: repair prompt inputs (failure JSON + draft), edit surface constraint (only generated markdown), full-rewrite patch method, and an explicit edit guard rejecting writes outside `grimoires/loa/ground-truth/`.
